alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Roanoke, west central Bedford and northeastern Franklin Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Northwest Smith Mountain Lake, or near Stewartsville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moneta... Stewartsville... Chamblissburg... Thaxton... Northwest Smith Mountain Lake... Goodview... and Roanoke Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
